Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Duplicated builds after opening a Android Designer" (#2248) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Android project (Android App, Modern Development)
2. Press Run. (1 full build happen)
3. Open Main.axml (no need to save, just open it)
4. Press Run. (2 full builds happen)

[DuplicatedBuild.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2435141/DuplicatedBuild.zip)

### Expected Behavior

No builds at all when there is no changes
A single build when there is changes

### Actual Behavior

2 full sequencial builds happen

### Investigated issues

Initially I thought it was the same as https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1394, but it seems it is not the case.

Then I saw `Input file "obj/Debug/build.props" is newer than output file "obj/Debug/libraryprojectimports.cache".` and thought it could be related to https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3929, but it is not.

Then looking the the **_CreatePropertiesCache** debug information I've noticed that its **WriteLinesToFile** is being executed due to the contents of `AdbTarget` being changed during the build.

### Log File

Using the following command to observe the **obj/Debug/build.props** contents: 
`while true; do kqwait '/Users/flash/Desktop/DuplicatedBuild/obj/Debug/build.props'; echo "------------------------------------------------------"; cat '/Users/flash/Desktop/DuplicatedBuild/obj/Debug/build.props'; done`

When you hit **Run** for the first time (step 2) it outputs:

```

AdbTarget=-s ce05171559d3cf0801
AdbOptions=
```

Also taking a look at Deploying to Device panel you will see the following output: 

```
Target "_CreatePropertiesCache" in file "/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets":
  Task "MakeDir" skipped, due to false condition; (!Exists('$(IntermediateOutputPath)')) was evaluated as (!Exists('obj/Debug/')).
  Task "WriteLinesToFile" skipped, due to false condition; ('@(_PropertiesCache)' != '@(_PropertyCacheItems)') was evaluated as ('BundleAssemblies=False;AotAssemblies=False;AndroidAotMode=;ExplicitCrunch=False;EnableProguard=;UseSharedRuntime=true;EmbedAssembliesIntoApk=False;AndroidLinkMode=None;AndroidLinkSkip=;AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion=27.0.3;AndroidSdkPath=;AndroidNdkPath=;JavaSdkPath=;AndroidSequencePointsMode=None;XamarinAndroidVersion=9.0.0-20;MonoSymbolArchive=False;AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk=true;TargetFrameworkVersion=v9.0;AndroidCreatePackagePerAbi=;OS=Unix;DesignTimeBuild=;AndroidIncludeDebugSymbols=True;AdbTarget=-s ce05171559d3cf0801;AdbOptions=' != 'BundleAssemblies=False;AotAssemblies=False;AndroidAotMode=;ExplicitCrunch=False;EnableProguard=;UseSharedRuntime=true;EmbedAssembliesIntoApk=False;AndroidLinkMode=None;AndroidLinkSkip=;AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion=27.0.3;AndroidSdkPath=;AndroidNdkPath=;JavaSdkPath=;AndroidSequencePointsMode=None;XamarinAndroidVersion=9.0.0-20;MonoSymbolArchive=False;AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk=true;TargetFrameworkVersion=v9.0;AndroidCreatePackagePerAbi=;OS=Unix;DesignTimeBuild=;AndroidIncludeDebugSymbols=True;AdbTarget=-s ce05171559d3cf0801;AdbOptions=').
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Some X.A targets do not respect Inputs/Outputs timestamp invariant" (#2247) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm debugging an incremental compilation for a project of ours and I have identified at least 3 spots where X.A targets are using `CopyIfChanged` or a variant-thereof and thus breaking inputs/outputs invariant.

What I mean by this is that you have plenty of scenarios where some target `Inputs` are newer than `Outputs` causing the target to run **yet** those updated Inputs will end up generating the same Outputs **content**. Because of the logic of `CopyIfChanged`, this mean that **no actual change** is committed to Outputs and thus when the target finishes executing you have broken the invariant that `Outputs` always have to be newer that your `Inputs`.

Three places where I have seen this (there might be more):

- `_CopyIntermediateAssemblies` (Outputs are also wrong for this one, they lack the satellites copy)
- `_GeneratePackageManagerJava`
- `_ResolveLibraryProjectImports`

I've struggled with the great number of references the Android project has, but found a way to fix most of them.

I'd like to know (at least) if my binding project is actually doable on Android, because the iOS counterpart is working.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "IntermediateOutputPath project attribute does not respect standard macros." (#2245) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Append the following parameter into yout Xamarin.Android .csproj file for the launched app. For instance, let it be MyProject.Android.csproj

```
  <PropertyGroup>
    <UseShortFileNames>True</UseShortFileNames>
    <IntermediateOutputPath>C:\Temp\$(ProjectName)</IntermediateOutputPath>
  </PropertyGroup>
```

2.  Initiate a rebuild.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The directory C:\Temp\MyProject.Android is expected to get created and contain what was previously held in obj directory next to the project source.

### Actual Behavior
The directory C:\Temp\MonoAndroid81 is created and contains what was previously held in obj directory next to the project source and thus several projects use the same directory.

### Version Information

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->
[VS_version_info.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2433675/VS_version_info.txt)


### Log File

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

Opened issue "Event EditText.KeyPress not called on real devices" (#2243) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
**### Steps to Reproduce**

1.  Clone sample issue: https://github.com/Goncharuk-Nikita/KeyPressIssue_NativeDroid (Basic Xamarin.Android Template with EditText)
2.  Put a breakpoint in the KeyPress event handler in MainActivity
![devenv_2018-10-01_09-57-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30652592/46274018-88f3a000-c560-11e8-8456-a4ec585dcda0.png)

3.  Run it on a real device, not on a simulator or emulator, because it works there.


**### Expected Behavior**

The KeyPress event should be invoked when I enter text using the Android keyboard and the program should stop at a breakpoint.


**### Actual Behavior**

The KeyPress event is not called on real devices, but it works on an emulator or simulator


**### Version Information**

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests] Fix BuildHelper Root" (#2242) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Some of the tests in monodroid are failing because
it was assumed that the test `Root` folder would be
in the project output directory.

However with the new `XAConfig` file changes in XA that
is no longer the case. As a result some of the unit tests
fail because it is looking for files in the wrong place.

This commit changes the `Root` property of the `ProjectBuilder`
to use the one from `XAConfig`.

### Description

When the Xamarin Forms Project builds the Android build fails.
The android is set to build to Release,and the linking is set to Sdk Assemblies only.
When it is set to None it builds successfully,but the apk is far too big then.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No resource found that matches given name" (#1730) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download braintree dropin .aar file from https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.braintreepayments.api/drop-in/3.3.0 
2. Now create a Xamarin android Class Library project and add .aar file into Jar folder and set build action as LibraryProjectZip

Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'textColorError'.

If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

It needs to compile .aar or .jar file successfully.
### Actual Behavior
Getting above error.
### Version Information
Download braintree dropin .aar file from https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.braintreepayments.api/drop-in/3.3.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WCF service integration does not work with Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4" (#1209) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When you create a new Xamarin Project in Visual Studio 2017 using .Net Standard libraries, the access to a WCF web service does no longer work. Even the example project by Xamarin does produce the same issue.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the Xamarin example: https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/xamarin-forms/cloud-services/consuming/wcf/
2. Build with Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4
3. Run Android App on a real device

### Expected Behavior
Method call to web service works (method: SoapService.RefreshDataAsync)

### Actual Behavior
Exception: The message with Action '' cannot be processed at the receiver, due to a ContractFilter mismatch at the EndpointDispatcher. This may be because of either a contract mismatch (mismatched Actions between sender and receiver) or a binding/security mismatch between the sender and the receiver.  Check that sender and receiver have the same contract and the same binding (including security requirements, e.g. Message, Transport, None).

### Basic Information

- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  Not tested
  - Android: Android SDK 7.1
  - UWP:  Not tested
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Tab A (2016)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] CopyResource should fail with an error code" (#2237) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/609

In a recent change, we removed `StubApplication.java`, but downstream
in `monodroid` we had MSBuild tasks that still expected the file to
exist.

We got an error such as:

    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: The "CopyResource" task failed unexpectedly.
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.CopyResource.Run (System.Reflection.Assembly assm, System.String ResourceName, System.String OutputPath, Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper Log) [0x00058] in <5782345e71104ee895a29d54bde93c43>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.CopyResource.Execute () [0x00018] in <5782345e71104ee895a29d54bde93c43>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute () [0x00023] in <528faf194f4946628868b84241d6ad15>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder+<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext () [0x001f6] in <528faf194f4946628868b84241d6ad15>:0

The `CopyResource` MSBuild task should fail more gracefully: log a
coded error, and mention the file name that was missing.

In addition to this change:
- Added `CopyResourceTests` to verify resources that should be
  working, and the error code if it fails. We should add to the list
  if there are other files we want to verify are working. This test is
  very fast (<1s for entire class), because it doesn't need to build
  an entire project.
- Documented the `XA0116` error code.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] Deprecate the `Page.UseSafeArea` property" (#3965) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary

The `Page.UseSafeArea` property is a bit strange in that it directly changes the Padding property. We might consider deprecating it and directing users to the `Page.SafeAreaInsets` property instead.


## API Changes

Remove `Page.UseSafeArea`

Events.RelatedBody: Adding the necessary InternalsVisibleTo attributes to allow the CollectionView preview packages to work with 3.3.0 and up while it's in the preview stage.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xib templates seem to need `customObjectInstantitationMethod="direct"` added" (#4902) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Xib files created from Xcode (from at least 9.4.1) have an additional `customObjectInstantitationMethod="direct"` property on their `document` property. 

Not sure why this is needed, there doesn't seem to be much documentation on it, but not having it breaks using `NSWindow.GetWindowWithContentViewController`. The window is created, and the content is there, but doesn't resize and doesn't always render correctly

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/iainx/testsplitpane
   This application opens two windows using view controllers defined in xib files. The Xib files are identical, except one has `customObjectInstantitationMethod="direct"` and the other doesn't.
2. Build and run. 
3. The broken window is missing the split pane's slider, and the content does not resize when you resize the window. The working window has neither of these issues.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XI]mscorlib test failure with release config  on  new iOS device" (#4901) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS stable build, Version: 12.0.0.15 (Visual Studio Enterprise)
Hash: 84552a4
2. Execute mscorlib tests on device with release config


### Expected Behavior
All tests pass
### Actual Behavior
Observed that TestGetFileLineNumber, TestGetFileName, TestFileName2 in StackFrameTest2 and StackFrameTest3 are failing.
